TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void ComponentRenameEventHandler(object sender, ComponentRenameEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed ComponentRenameEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle a event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you create a ComponentRenameEventHandler delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event-handler delegates, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
## Examples The following example demonstrates registering a ComponentRenameEventHandler and handling the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentRename> event.
[!code-cpp[ComponentRenameEventHandlerExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.componentmodel._128_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[ComponentRenameEventHandlerExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.componentmodel._128_1.cs)] [!code-vb[ComponentRenameEventHandlerExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.componentmodel._128_1.vb)]
